title: Practical 1: PCA
text:
Edit the code below and click “Run”.
#| '!! shinylive warning !!': |
#|   shinylive does not work in self-contained HTML documents.
#|   Please set `embed-resources: false` in your metadata.
#| standalone: true
#| viewerHeight: 700

library(shiny)

# 1. The User Interface (Inputs)
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("Interactive PCA Explorer"),
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      helpText("Adjust parameters to see how the PCA changes."),
      
      # Toggle for Scaling
      checkboxInput("scale", "Scale Variables? (Recommended)", TRUE),
      
      # Select which PCs to display
      numericInput("pc_x", "PC for X-axis:", 1, min = 1, max = 5),
      numericInput("pc_y", "PC for Y-axis:", 2, min = 1, max = 5),
      
      hr(),
      p("Scaling is critical in Multivariate Stats when variables have different units.")
    ),
    
    # 2. The Output (Visuals)
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("pca_plot"),
      verbatimTextOutput("pca_summary")
    )
  )
)

# 3. The R Server Logic
server <- function(input, output) {
  
  # Reactive PCA calculation
  pca_data <- reactive({
    prcomp(mtcars, scale. = input$scale, center = TRUE)
  })
  
  # Render the Biplot
  output$pca_plot <- renderPlot({
    biplot(pca_data(), choices = c(input$pc_x, input$pc_y), 
           main = paste("PCA: PC", input$pc_x, "vs PC", input$pc_y))
  })
  
  # Render the Summary table
  output$pca_summary <- renderPrint({
    summary(pca_data())
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)
